alert.note: Alert for Fairfield; Licking (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 24 at 8:07PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHEASTERN FAIRFIELD AND SOUTHWESTERN LICKING COUNTIES THROUGH 845 PM EDT... At 807 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located over Millersport, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Locations impacted include... Pataskala, Baltimore, Buckeye Lake, Hebron, Bremen, Millersport, Pleasantville, Fairfield Beach, Harbor Hills, Beechwood Trails, Etna, Thurston, Kirkersville, Rushville, West Rushville, State Route 158 at State Route 204 and Interstate 70 at State Route 37. This includes I-70 in Ohio between mile markers 114 and 131. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for central Ohio. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
